intro: Calceolaria umbellata, commonly known as the fringed gentian, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is characterized by its striking, hooded flowers that resemble small bells, with a distinctive fringed lip. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, preferring cool, moist environments with well-drained soil. Its flowers bloom in shades of blue, violet, and white, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Calceolaria umbellata is a member of the Gentianaceae family, known for its showy and colorful blooms.
